def total_plot(d_df, feature, title, font_size=14, width=800,color='Magenta'): d_df.columns = [feature, 'Total'] d_df = d_df.sort_values(by=['Total'], ascending = False)[0:20] hover_text = [] for index, row in d_df.iterrows(): hover_text.append((f"{feature}: {row[feature]}
"+f"Total: {row['Total']}")) d_df['hover_text'] = hover_text trace = go.Bar( x = d_df[feature],y = d_df['Total'], name='Total', marker=dict(color=color), text = hover_text, ) data = [trace] layout = dict(title = title, yaxis = dict(title = 'Total', showticklabels=True), xaxis = dict(title = feature, showticklabels=True, tickfont=dict( family='Old Standard TT, serif', size=font_size, color='black'),), hovermode = 'closest', showlegend=False, width=width, height=600, ) fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout) iplot(fig, filename='doc-boards-1') d_df = nia_df.groupby(['Year'])['Title'].nunique().reset_index() total_plot(d_df, 'Year', 'Total number of theses per year - National Intelligence Academy',color='Red')

source.3b79e72b:
def plot_total_role(d_df, title=''):
    d_df.columns = ['Name', 'Role', 'Total']
    d_df = d_df.sort_values(by=['Total'], ascending = False)[0:50]

    dc_df = d_df.loc[d_df.Role=='Chairman']
    traceC = go.Bar(
        x = dc_df['Name'],y = dc_df['Total'],
        name='Chairman',
        marker=dict(color='Red'),
        text = dc_df['Name'],
    )

    da_df = d_df.loc[d_df.Role=='Advisor']
    traceA = go.Bar(
        x = da_df['Name'],y = da_df['Total'],
        name='Advisor',
        marker=dict(color='Yellow'),
        text = da_df['Name'],
    )

    dr_df = d_df.loc[(d_df.Role=='Reviewer')]
    traceR = go.Bar(
        x = dr_df['Name'],y = dr_df['Total'],
        name='Reviewer',
        marker=dict(color='Blue'),
        text = dr_df['Name'],
    )


    data = [traceC, traceA, traceR]

    layout = dict(title = title,
              yaxis = dict(title = 'Total', showticklabels=True),
              xaxis = dict(title = 'Name', showticklabels=True, tickfont=dict(
                    family='Old Standard TT, serif',
                    size=10,
                    color='black'),), 
                  hovermode = 'closest',
                  barmode='stack',
                  showlegend=True,
                      width=800,
                      height=600,
             )
    fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
    iplot(fig, filename='doc-boards-1') 
d_df = nia_df.groupby(['Name', 'Role'])['Title'].count().reset_index()
plot_total_role(d_df, title='Board attendance  - National Intelligence Academy - split per roles (top 30)')

def total_year_plot(data_df, title, font_size=14, width=800,color='Magenta'):
    data = []
    for person in all_list:
        d_df = data_df.loc[data_df.Name==person].groupby(['Year'])['Candidate'].count().reset_index()
        d_df.columns = ['Year', 'Total']
    
        trace = go.Scatter(
            x = d_df['Year'],y = d_df['Total'],
            name=person,
            text = person,
        )
        data.append(trace)
        
    layout = dict(title = title,
            yaxis = dict(title = 'Total', showticklabels=True),
            xaxis = dict(title = 'Year', showticklabels=True, tickfont=dict(
                    family='Old Standard TT, serif',
                    size=font_size,
                    color='black'),), 
            hovermode = 'x',
            showlegend=True,   
            width=width,
            height=600,
             )
    fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
    iplot(fig, filename='doc-boards-1')

source.bd025613:
import matplotlib
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline 
from wordcloud import WordCloud, STOPWORDS
def show_wordcloud(data, title=""):
    text = " ".join(t for t in data.dropna())
    stopwords = set(STOPWORDS)
    stopwords.update(["şi", "în", "de", "cu", "la", "o", "un", "ul", "din", "ului", "asupra", "privind", "pentru"])
    wordcloud = WordCloud(stopwords=stopwords, scale=4, max_font_size=50, max_words=500,background_color="black").generate(text)
    fig = plt.figure(1, figsize=(16,16))
    plt.axis('off')
    fig.suptitle(title, fontsize=20)
    fig.subplots_adjust(top=2.3)
    plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='bilinear')
    plt.show()

source.c7c1d054:
The Talented Mr. Oprea and his Friends



1. Introduction


We analyze here the doctoral boards in Military Academies in Romania, based on partial data obtained through the law for accesing public data. Although in Romania these information are public, the authorities are not automatically publish even the name of the doctoral candidates or the thesys name. Analyzing this data might reveal interesting facts about how these boards were assembled, who is part of the boards, who is presiding, who is the most frequent adviser and who is appearing in most of the boards on various roles, from president to adviser to reviewer. Moreover, we can look to the theses subjects (and try to se ehow diverse is the spectrum of one advisor competences) as well as to the names of the candidates associated with the most frequent advisers. The data is from 3 sources: - The National Intelligence Academy (Intelligence Services Academy); - The Police Academy; - The National Defense Academy (Military/Army Academy)

* Constantin Romanoschi
source.6de4ca26:
Data exploration

Let's start by trying to answer to such questions: * How many doctoral thesis were granted per year? * Who were the most active board members (per each academy)? * Which are the most active board members by role? * Which are the most active board members - overall? * What was the time dynamics of these boards? When the story started and how this evolved? * What are the specialization (from thesis titles, where the information is available)? * Can we identify persistent teams of board members - who is teaming-up to form doctoral thesis boards (groups of 2,3,4,5)?

source.5359859f: Let's look now to the theses subjects. Since the theses titles are all in Romanian, text pre-processing will most probably keep some of the stopwords.
source.e212d57b:
Theodor Frunzeti is the absolute leader of doctoral studies in Romania, being chairman of the doctoral boards in 186 cases, advisor for 31 candidates and as well reviewer for 45 boards, a total of 262 presences in doctoral boards. 

Viorel Buta is following, with 102 presences as chairman of the board and Vasile Bucinschi in 80.

We will follow with inspecting the number doctoral boards attended per year by each of these people.   

We aggregate all the datasets and we also perform some data cleaning on all the data.
source.fc574a01:
The year 2011 was the `anno mirabilis` for the defense, police and intelligence research in Romania.

Especially the following advisors:

* Anghel Andreescu (8 doctoral students)  
* Teodor Frunzeti (8 doctoral students)  
* Marius Hanganu (7 doctoral students)  
* Gheorghe Toma (7 doctoral students)  
* Gabriel Oprea (7 doctoral students)  
* Constantin Onisor (6 doctoral students)  

are the absolute performers in terms of leading doctoral research. 

Anghel Andreescu is a real performer, since he equals his performance of 2008, when he also had 8 doctoral students defending the theses.
source.3c82094d:
In terms of chairman performances, the year 2011 is the absolute zenith of doctoral studies in Romania, if we are looking to the military academies (and especially the Defense Academy). The absolute performers are:

* Teodor Frunzeti (71 doctoral boards chaired)  
* Viorel Buta (41 doctoral boards chaired)  
* Vasile Bucinscki (27 doctoral boards chaired)  

Most probably the chairman is just an honorific position, and is probably taken by one of the academy managers (probably one very senior general from the structure of command of the respective academy) but considering that the number of working days in a year is approximately 250, one of these chairmans took 30% of his working days to chair doctoral boards!!
